article.name: Access to Message Denied Because It Has Expired
article.title: Access to Message Denied Because It Has Expired
article.body:
You may see the error below when attempting to open a secure email:

This error occurs when the sender has placed time restrictions on the email, and you are trying to access it before or after those restrictions.

To access this email, the message's author must alter the time and date restrictions. Once this has been done, you can view the email.

images.alt:
This image displays a system notification indicating an access restriction error.

**UI Elements and Context:**
The notification features a standard error icon on the left: a red 'X' centered within a red circular outline, signifying a critical failure or denial.

**Text and Content:**
The accompanying black text explains the reason for the restriction. The full text reads:
"Access to message "RB-181227-144623" is denied because it has expired."

**Data and Function:**
The message explicitly identifies the resource being accessed by a unique ID, **"RB-181227-144623"**. The failure condition is based on the **expiration** status of the specified message.
